body:
### Language server

rust_analyzer

### Requested feature

In VSCode, external crates are skipped and not added to the `workspace_folders`.

This is not the case for the root_dir function in lsp-config.

The consequence is that using `goto definition` on a symbol which takes you to source code in `~/.cargo/registry/src/...` the external crate is added and rust-analyzer will then run `cargo check` or `cargo clippy` inside that folder as well, which will cause diagnostics from those crates to show up in workspace diagnostics.

This results in both increased time for producing diagnostics and other linting when saving, as RA has to check more, as well as cluttering the results of workspace diagnostics with warnings from other crates or the standard library, which are plentiful.

Relevant solution, which doesn't work with cargo workspaces as it uses a completely different root pattern resolution than the built in one: https://users.rust-lang.org/t/neovim-lsp-shows-diagnostic-for-external-crates/89842/3

### Other clients which have this feature

_No response_

comment_data.body: as far as i know `rust_analyzer`  does not support lsp `workspace_folders` . you mean vscode workspace?

No, I noticed that `print(vim.inspect(vim.lsp.buf.list_workspace_folders()))` shows that external crates are added.
`{ "/Users/teiroberts/dev/Ambient" }`

after using `goto` on a wgpu type or something inside std:

`{ "/Users/teiroberts/dev/Ambient", "/Users/teiroberts/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/wgpu-types-0.14.1", "/Users/teiroberts/.rustup/toolchains/stable-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core" }
`

![Screenshot 2023-03-20 at 13 30 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25723553/226339489-7739ec4a-8d55-49b8-b9e5-349898e23fd2.png)
it just passed root dir into it.the rust analyzer not support lsp workspace relate features

I understand.

What I am asking for is the ability to ignore/return nil for the root dir function for external crates, and which would be the best way to hook into or chain the root dir function without copying it raw to achieve the desired behavior which VSCode exhibits.

I.e; not showing diagnostics and running check on external deps.

Thank you for your help.

Same problem with `pyright`.

When i use `goto definition` to look for some dependency code, i end up with my workspace diagnostics full of `venv` error messages.
Do you know why VSCode doesn't experience this issue but we do?
if you don't want start rust_analyzer in your `.cargo` folder you can check it in root dir function .
That is one solution, but prevents goto definition when looking inside a dependency, which vs code supports still
does vscode spawn two rust_analyzer process or only reuse one ?

When i open definition in vscode, it displays problems for that file.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/301015/235890162-146a0a4b-5f58-480e-bc6e-e8dabf11337d.png)

But when i close that tab, problem list is cleared.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/301015/235890295-658f9e35-06a8-468b-8b29-66744ca6ce80.png)

It works with single pylance server running:

```
ps ax | grep -E '[p]ylance'
  89076 ?        Sl     0:16 /usr/lib/electron19/electron /home/serg/.vscode-oss/extensions/ms-python.vscode-pylance-2023.4.40/dist/server.bundle.js --cancellationReceive=file:2340df95b645411d81926a21616e9597105d30da0e --node-ipc --clientProcessId=89000
```

In neovim, error list is populated after opening definition:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/301015/235890982-f975872d-10d4-454f-86d5-8795745b821b.png)

And not cleared after closing definition:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/301015/235891145-ee9e97b8-26c2-48e5-99db-2e7223b41fe4.png)

vscode use pylance it's not open souce server. pyright is pyright ! and as i said currently lspconfig will check the server support `workspaceFolders` or not . if server not support lspconfig will spawn a new server instance. I most want to how vscode handle rust_analyzer 

ref https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#workspace_workspaceFolders

I think I know what the problem is . in vim/neovim we don't have workspace. as default should one nvim instance is a workspace. all project opened should reuse the active server . in vim-lsp it provide a workspace_config field. we should provide a command to make user  We should have provided a simulated workspace table. When the user wants the project to run in a new workspace, manually use a command to add it to the workspace and then check whether the server supports the workspaceFolder feature. If support reuse server send workspace/didchangeworkspacefolder notify otherwise start new server. The logic that currently checks to start the server is not correct ..

What exactly is a *workspace* in this case?

What would be the way forward for this, because I find myself having to restart neovim if I do `gd` on a library symbol because it will spend a longer time running clippy on the deps, and then clutter the diagnostics with errors (e.g due to features not being enabled or use of unstable library features if in stdlib)

Thanks for the help
update the latest version rust_analyzer and test with  definition i can't reproduce this .

managed to reproduce with version 2023-05-22

![image](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/assets/3968357/b530f9bb-0846-4d2f-b50e-33aeca7bd974)

The workspace of vscode does not exist in neovim. It is also not possible to simply set a workspace for each root. This is wrong behavior. So I implemented the concept of a workspace in lspconfig. The way it works is. You can create multiple worksapce. A default space is automatically created when the first project is opened. If you don't change the workspace. All open projects will belong to the default space. When you open the project after changing the workspace shown, it will check whether the server supports the workspace_folder feature. Send didchangeworkspacefolder notification if supported. Re-use the server. Otherwise a new server instance will be started. 

for this issue . now it works like this  
1. open `helloword` project now lspconfig will create a `default` workspace. 
2. run `go to definition` it open file which in sysroot. but it still in default workspace . so reuse client and don't send notify 
  even the `rust_analyzer` now support `workspaceFodler`. 
3. now it don't show any diagnostic

![Untitled](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/assets/41671631/4856c747-9257-4236-818b-378ca00ac28d)

It seems as I mayhaps missed something.

`goto definition` to a library like `std` still produced thousands of diagnostics which remain even after closing any buffer inside `std`?

Thanks for your help so far ❤️

with latest version ?  when i navigate to `local/share/rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/libra│
ry/std/src/lib.rs `  my `RUSTUP` env path . I didn't get any diagnostic.  provide reproduce step .

lspconfig:
```
    ● nvim-lspconfig 21.77ms   mason.nvim
        dir    /Users/teiroberts/.local/share/nvim/lazy/nvim-lspconfig
        url    https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig
        branch master
        commit b6b34b9
        readme README.md
        help   |lspconfig.txt|
        help   |lspconfig-all|
```
rust-analyzer
```
    ◍ rust-analyzer rust_analyzer
      rust-analyzer is an implementation of the Language Server Protocol for the
      Rust programming language. It provides features like completion and goto
      definition for many code editors, including VS Code, Emacs and Vim.
      
      
      installed version 2023-06-26                                 
      homepage          https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer 
      languages         Rust                                       
      categories        LSP                                        
      executables       rust-analyzer                              
```

Steps to reproduce:

`lua vim.lsp.buf.definition()`
on
```
std::net::IpAddr
```

This navigates to `/Users/teiroberts/.rustup/toolchains/stable-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/net/mod.rs`

`fidget.nvim` shows that rust-analyzer is indexing.

Wait until it is done indexing

Go to the previous buffer (your source code) and delete the *std* buffer using telescope buffers.

```lua
vim.diagnostic.setqflist()
```

![Screenshot 2023-06-27 at 13 14 00](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/assets/25723553/d35c78f6-add1-457b-b1b4-73336af80b1e)

What do you use to view all the diagnostics?
I may add that this also occurs on my other machines running Linux, so it is not mac specific. All latest versions

I only get main.rs . source file no diangositcs  . btw I don't use mason and fidget. but i think it's not relate. could you try min config 

![image](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/assets/41671631/f5d51d0a-1594-47b8-8743-eff58eaf930a)

Removing `rust-tools` solves the issue, and rust-analyzer seems a lot faster (especially as it is not re-indexing now).

Thanks for implementing the feature, now that I can make use of it is very useful.

I've been on and off rust-tools since it has some issues, but also useful things such as `:RustRunnables` but I have since moved that into another plugin, so I think I can entirely move away from rust-tools.

Thanks for your time 👍
because I make lspconfig  root run in coroutine then rewrite rust-analyzer get workspace . it async now so it's fast.

Wow, so it wasn't just placebo. Amazing.

No more mini-hiccups with `goto-definitions`, something which I didn't even know was caused by lsp-config. Thought it was file loading.

❤️
no problem then enjoy :)

I'm confused. This thread seems to indicate the issue doesn't exist anymore, but I'm still having this exact issue. I've been trying to fix it for over a week at this point with still no clue why it's doing this. I only started using neovim recently and all I used is the default config from kickstart.nvim. Whenever I open a file that is from a dependency and not in the CWD it starts running a cargo check. I've resorted to using `autostart = false` and start it manually. When I use `:LspStart` at the root of a rust project everything works fine and it doesn't try to run cargo check outside of the cwd but if I let autostart do it's thing then it tries to run cargo check in other files that I definitely don't want ti to.

title: rust_analyzer skip root_dirs for external crates inside `~/.cargo`
